snippet.textDisplay: My FAVE! I may be 18, but even though video games have come a LONG way since I was a kid, but I still prefer me some Ratchet and Clank or some Spyro every now and again. The music was absolutely divine and the story lines were superb. <3 Ahh, Nostalgia.

snippet.textDisplay: Wtf. Each game is set up for a sequel. And sometimes, with certain stories and certain gameplay styles, it isn't easy to do that. The endings are hardly memorable, I honestly can't recall much myself. But it doesn't matter to me. I wouldn't judge it by that alone.
snippet.textOriginal: Wtf. Each game is set up for a sequel. And sometimes, with certain stories and certain gameplay styles, it isn't easy to do that. The endings are hardly memorable, I honestly can't recall much myself. But it doesn't matter to me. I wouldn't judge it by that alone.

snippet.textDisplay:
What do you need to know? That the series have pioneered modern platforming since its inception? That is has constantly stayed on the edge of the current technology? That as complex as it can become, it has always been fun and satisfying to master and complete each game? That as a game it is unique for being a third person shooter and a platform game? And most prominently here, that it has a distinguishable and delightful soundtrack? 

These things are true, for the games 1 through 3.
snippet.textOriginal:
What do you need to know? That the series have pioneered modern platforming since its inception? That is has constantly stayed on the edge of the current technology? That as complex as it can become, it has always been fun and satisfying to master and complete each game? That as a game it is unique for being a third person shooter and a platform game? And most prominently here, that it has a distinguishable and delightful soundtrack? 

These things are true, for the games 1 through 3.

snippet.textDisplay: this game is SUBLIME!  i have to say r+c2 was a little boring compared to this. I KNOW it introduced a lot of new cool stuff, but it just didn't make up for the loss of the feeling of starting from scratch that you get in r+c1 eg. having to collect body armour and clanks hover and thruster packs, ractchet and clank two started two suddenly, (ZAPP! you're in another galaxy! PING! weeks have passed and now you are a fully trained soldier! ZOWIE! your on your first mission! Y'know?)
snippet.textOriginal: this game is SUBLIME!  i have to say r+c2 was a little boring compared to this.
